events.message: Customer reported a car collision that occurred at an intersection, resulting in moderate vehicle damage.
The claim has been categorized as an auto accident based on keywords related to the vehicle collision event.
An experienced claims agent was assigned to handle the auto accident case and guide the customer through the process.
Customer received an official acknowledgment of the claim submission with reference number and next steps.
Request sent to customer for police reports, vehicle damage photos, and driver's license to support the claim.
Customer uploaded all required documents including police report, photos, and insurance card to the portal.
The investigation team began reviewing submitted evidence and contacted involved parties to verify details.
Investigation concluded with confirmation that the customer was not at fault in the vehicle collision incident.
A settlement offer was proposed covering repair costs and rental vehicle expenses due to the auto accident.
Customer responded positively to the settlement proposal and expressed satisfaction with the handling of the claim.
Claim officially approved after all terms agreed upon and documentation verified for payment processing.
Settlement payment was issued to the customerâ€™s bank account for the full agreed amount for vehicle repairs.
The auto accident claim was closed successfully after payment issuance and confirmation from the customer.
All records and documents related to the car accident claim were archived for future reference and compliance.
